basics.name: Cade Kane
basics.label: Student at UH Mānoa
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences and minoring in Biology in the Department of Natural Sciences at the University of Hawaiʻi at Mānoa. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2025.

work.summary: Conducts mentored bioinformatics research on colorectal cancer at the John A. Burns School of Medicine. Participates in health workshops and monthly meetings.

work.company: UH Molecular Biosciences & Bioengineering, Du Lab
work.summary: Conducted directed research under the Du Lab to construct a cost-effective photobioreactor for cultivating photosynthetic microorganisms.

volunteer.organization: Native Hawaiian Science and Engineering Mentorship Program (NHSEMP)
volunteer.summary: Engages in STEM-focused events and programs to network with peers and mentors, promoting STEM to Native Hawaiian students.
highlights: Tutor for ENGR100 course for freshmen
On-Track Mentor for Lanai High School capstone projects

volunteer.summary: Practices programming skills and problem-solving. Takes part in mock technical interviews to prepare for a career in software engineering.

awards.title: USDA-HEC CRISPR Summer Workshop Certificate
awards.awarder: Du Lab, Dept of Molecular Biosciences & Bioengineering, Agricultural Sciences Building
awards.summary: Learned to work with CRISPR constructs, guide RNAs, digital droplet PCR, and used a confocal microscope.
